page.title: 02A VIEW OF BUCKLAND BREWER
page.content:
IN OUR AREA WE HAVE TWO{RIVERS} CALLED{YEO}AND{DUNTZ.}THEY HAVE QUITE A LOT OF SMALL{STREAMS}JOINING THEM.THE DUNTZ IS QUITE NARROW WITH PEBBLES AT THE BOTTOM.THE DUNTZ JOINS THE RIVER YEO WHICH JOINS THE RIVER TORRIDGE.THE VALLEYS HAVE GENTLY SLOPING SIDES AND LEVEL FLOORS. THE{BRIDGES}CROSSING OVER THE YEO AND DUNTZ ARE STONE.
THE AREA IS DOMINATED BY THE VILLAGE OF{BUCKLAND BREWER},WHICH INCLUDES SEVERAL DOZEN NEW AND OLD BUILDINGS. THE{CHURCH}IS NAMED AFTER SAINT MARY AND SAINT BENEDICT.IT IS VERY OLD AND IS MADE OF STONE,ON THE ROOF IT HAS SLATES.THE CHURCH HAS A TOWER WITH SIX BELLS. THE{CHAPEL}IS MADE OF STONE AND YELLOW BRICK.THE ROOF IS MADE OF SLATE
